Reviews.Title: “Don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: sukar
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 months in advance. When we arrived they moved us to a different hotel down the street, the Hotel Rubina. They said it was the same thing. It was terrible. We had ants. The room door was constantly stuck. We had to carry our luggage up a thin flight of stairs. Our friends' room didn't have a toilet seat. There was not shower curtain. Our security was an elderly lady in pajamas that we had to wake up . The TV, airconditioner and phone did not work. It was above a hang out for questionable people. For breakfast we had to walkr down the street to a deli and were only allowed one cup of coffee and one sweet roll. It wasn't worth anywhere near the price they charged. It was very close to the train.

Reviews.Title: “A few Steps from All the Action!”
Reviews.Author: Centella9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the beds were comfortable. The air conditioning came in handy and the flat screen tv had great reception. We stayed in the family suite and was never bothered. It was very quiet, in fact we were probably the loudest on the floor. The maid came in to change the towels everyday, even though she was rude. There were no other accommodations other than the tv, air conditioning unit, telephone, and a safe. We had a view to the street front and it was so nice to see Rome lit up at night. Pretty romantic! I think the price was not worth the accommodations but it was the cheapest we could find. It was right around the block from the main Terminal to catch the train. So much to see in so little time!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoykoShumen_Bulgaria
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for travellers that need a hotel just for sleep and prefer to use their time for sightseeing,shopping or meals outside.Next to Termini station from where connections to the city center or Fiumichino airport are very easy.Breakfast is included in the price and could take it in the Caffeteria near by.The hotel is worth for money in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: ki_lih
Reviews.Content: We booked in to stay at Hotel Soggiorno Blu, on via Magenta, prior to leaving Australia and thus prior to seeing the room. We arrived at Hotel Soggiorno Blu, and it goes pretty much like the other reviews. 1) We were asked to pay upon arrival without seeing the room 2) We were moved to anotehr Hotel just round the corner, being Hotel Rubino 3) We were placed in a room right beside reception 4) The bathroom was small, and very unclean with mould all over the tiles of the shower. All I had to do was hold the shower to the mould and it came away, so i'm unsure why it hadn't been cleaned. 5) Our 'ensuite' bathroom had a shower and sink only - no toilet! We had to use our own toilet down the hallway = not happy. As per the other reviews, breakfast, which consisted only of a pastry and coffee (both of which were very tasty though :) was held at the cafe across the road. The sheets were clean in the room, and it did have a TV and safe as advertised. Dodgy dodgy establishment, not recommended to stay at any of the hotels owned by the management who runs Hotel Soggiorno Blue/Hotel Rubino.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER BOOK a ROOM in this DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: toothumbsup
Reviews.Content: The Worst Hotel I have stayed at in my whole life! All of the things that happened in all the other Negative reviews also happened to us! Made us move to Rubinos Hotel which is also a DUMP! Dirty with mold all over the bathroom and I am talking about both Hotels. I wish I had of read all of these other reviews here before booking! They made us move the first night to Rubinos after we took all our bags up the tiny elevator in 3 trips then back down in the rain to walk a block to Rubinos and another 3 trips up that elevator. I complained all the way to no avail. The next day I went and told them to put us in Blu because that was what we booked and they said the manager would be at Planet so had to go there. Was told that they would try to fix it by the maid as manager was not around. Come back in 30 minutes went back and said ok you can move back but then the manager wanted to be apologetic but I said that was bait and switch and I had not even seen the inside of the Blu rooms which I thought would be better---oops I was wrong. He was very rude and did not want to listen to my complaints instead got in a huff and walked away! I did not even get to the part about the MOLD on the bathroom walls which affected my daughters breathing in the night. She slept with the bathroom door shut and no one took a shower because Rubinos was terrible! The Blu rooms were a little better but still NO 2 star maybe 0 star and that is a stretch. Well I could keep complaining but I feel I have said enough so you know to NEVER EVER STAY in this DUMP or you will be SORRY and Unhappy with your trip to Rome. The only reason we disliked Rome was all because of this Hotel. The trip to Florence then Venice and back was fantastic but Rome Sucked all because I book rooms at the S. Blu. Also do not stay in Planet or Rubinos because they are owned by the same people!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience in rome”
Reviews.Author: Keith19835
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, this is the worst hotel I have stayed in. The Hotel is very dirty. From the moment we walked in, we could see the dirt on the walls. The lift was filty. They tried to move us to a different hotel - down the street. That hotel was even worse. We had to pay in advance, and were told to collect the tickets for the breakfast in the morning which started at 7. When we went to the desk - no one was there. We went down to the coffee shop where we were told to go the previous evening. Did not open on time. This was also filty. They would not entertain us without our tickets. Do not go to this hotel. Although the location is great for the termini, nothing is worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Soggiorno Blu Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Soggiorno Blu after a little corespondence with this and another hotel; Was looking for a budget hotel just to sleep and shower/bathe in before starting another long day sightseeing, so not looking to spend too long in the hotel, so comfortable or plush facilities were not top on my agenda on this visit. Firstly, value and cleandliness were very good, the cost was 80 euros for a double room per night with breakfast included, and we could check in from 10am - ideal when arriving off early morning ryan air flights! On arrival at the hotel I was surprised to find it was in a building which housed several other hotels - each occupying a seperate floor. I had checked with the hotel if it was accessable (I am a wheelchair user but dont need an adapted room as I can stand and manage a few steps with a walking stick) and was assured that there was a room that would accomodate my needs, and as rooms were small, I could leave my wheelchair at reception so as not to clutter room with it, which I thought was kind and helpful, I was also reassured there was a lift - which there was, however it was accessed after first climbing up 3 steep steps. On arrival at the hotel, we buzzed the doorbell and the maid let us in after only a minute, after another minute we were checked in and given our room. The room was right next to the reception and was small with an extremely small bathroom - the whole thing toilet and shower as sink unit was 1 yard square, however I could sit on loo and shower at same time! The bed linen was clean an crisp and the room was clean, with tv which had an english speaking, american news channel - cnn I think, but not sure. The room being next to reception was very noisy, and after 10pm we needed to use our keys to enter as reception does not work, so after this time it was noiser still, as people arrived with no concern for sleeping guests, so if you do consider going to this hotel, ask for another room if given the one next to reception. Breakfast was taken at a little bar on the corner of the street, however on first morning we slept in till 10am so missed breakfast, and on next morning we could not actually access the bar with the wheelchair and were asked to leave me outside, while my husband went in an ate breakfast stood at bar then brough some out for me, needless to say this option was not taken up and we had a lovely roll and coffee at the station, just round corner and accross road. On the third day we left before breakfast bar opened, so I cannot make any comments on food or breakfast except to say they were not accomodating, wether that was because they had already seen the vouchers the hotel issue to exchange for breakfast, so knew we were not paying customers I do not know but suspect they may have helped more if they thought there was cash at stake. The hotel arranged our transfere back to the airport for us, and helped us down with bags at 7am. All in all it is a good location, clean and basic hotel (more of an old B&B than a hotel) but good value, I would recommend it if you were not a wheelchair user and looking for a bargain place to crash near the transport network. If you are looking for a nice place to have a break, look somewhere else or you may be a tad disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this 'hotel' !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ineedtotravelmore
Reviews.Content: #1 Do not confuse Hotel Soggiorno Blu on Via Magenta with Hotel Blu Roma. #2 The hotel is located in a 'scary' part of Rome, but is very close to the train station, it's only good quality. A maid checked us in to Hotel Blu by taking our passports, which were returned. We were then notified that we were being moved to Hotel Planet. #3 Hotel Blu is affiliated with 5 other 2 star or lower hotels and will move you wherever they choose after you check in! #4 Hotel Planet was dirty, and by dirty, I mean other people's hair in the shower and their leftover soap. I actually had to ask for soap and towels. #5 The view from the room was of an alleyway. There is a no smoking policy because if the hotel were to ever catch on fire, you would never get out! #6 The staff was hard to find, once found extremely rude and unhelpful. We lasted all of TWO HOURS and checked-out, that's how bad it was. You can check in but you can't check out - meaning this nightmare will stay with you whenever you make another reservation........ This review is the subjective opinion

Reviews.Title: “Soggiorno Blu Hotel, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: GInny_9
Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel next to Termini Station, ideal location for travelling around the city. You get a token for a local cafe to get your breakfast which consists of a cup of coffee or orange juice and a pastry. This hotel is very basic and I had read a couple of reviews on it before I went. Being asked for payment on arrival before seeing the room, being asked to move to another hotel, not the Soggiorno Blu, obviously the other hotel(s) Hotel Planet being one of the hotels run by the same receptionist! So a delay in service at the desk. Internet is not free, you have to go to Hotel Planet to get access to the internet and it costs 5 Euros. The area is noisy and dirty and the rooms facing onto the "courtyard" are quieter but you have the bottles being emptied early in the morning and the waiters from nearby restaurants shouting at night! Your view consists of various makes of air conditioning fans! My experience was as I expected however on my return home the treatment I received from the manager is explained below. Economic should not reflect poor service and being asked to pay cash on arrival abruptly was off putting to start with but I had read on Trip Advisor this would happen, despite the hotel advertising they take cards. When the receptionist put my card through, I later found out since arriving home that it was to test the card and they deducted the price of the room and then added it back on however with the difference in exchange rates I am now £22 down. I have been assured by the hotel manager this will be put back onto my account within the next 15 days but the correspondence I have had from him, Fabio Alvisini, is the most arrogant, rude and abrasive I have ever come across. To treat your customers in the manner he has is quite unbelievable, I am flabbergasted! I would not recommend this hotel to anybody as the treatment of their customers is absolutely despicable. The hotel was clean enough but being on my honeymoon I wanted a double bed and got two single beds pushed together! We had to ask for clean towels after two days use also I would not recommend this hotel to anybody. There are other cheap hotels in Rome which will give you far better service. Do not stay in SOGGIORNO BLU

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Soggiorno Blu Hotel, for convenience to the Termini for the early Terravision bus back to the airport.. from the little time i stayed there, the room was very good, clean and bright ..bathroom very nice too, looked onto a courtyard that was very tatty, but no problem. Reception is reached by a lift, you then press the buzzer, some one will come and check you in, we watied around 15 minutes, receptionist was very nice and helpful, also buzzed as the heating was not working, waited a while for the chap to come, but he fixed it. The delay at reception is because they are running 2 or 3 other hotels, either in the same building or close by. Never had breakfast but she gave us a ticket for the bar on the corner. The hotel served our purpose, I'm not sure how it would have been for a longer stay, but I would certainly stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Afrando
Reviews.Content: Location: Easy to find from Termini station and close to a number of restaurants. The area is VERY safe and quite lively. It is by no means a scary and intimidating place as other reviews made it sound. I stayed here with my partner in Dec 08 although we spent our first night in another hotel across the street (owned by the same management) as the receptionist at Blu was VERY deceptive about our room (She looks like America Ferrerra and her name is Cecilia. Avoid if possible!) My boyfriend put up a fight when we realised we had been cheated and we were moved to Blu which was much nicer by comparision. We stayed in a double room which had a tv. The bathroom was clean too. Breakfast was included (they give you a ticket for a bar downstairs which entitles you to a pastry and hot drink). If returning, i wouldnt stay here but would definatley stay around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of all Hotel Planet owned hotels”
Reviews.Author: BookingNextTrip
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we've ever stayed at with the most useless staff. It is run by Hotel Planet who own a handful of other hotels in Termini Station area and all are as useless as each other. We arrived at Blu and were told we needed to move to the other building to complete check-in (they expect payment on arrival). When we settled into our room we realised we weren't in Blu at all but Hotel Rubino (the receptionist actually deceived us). The room itself was adequate and it had a phone but the bathroom was horrible. The toilet didn't have a seat and the shower was filthy. Furthermore we were too scared to turn on the heater for fear the inch-thick dust inside would catch fire. Before I complained I did a quick internet search and found that not only did Rubino have horrible reviews (whereas Blu's, at the time of booking at least, were adequate) but it had a special deal going for less than what we'd paid! I complained and the next morning we were moved to Blu and put in a family room (which apparently was an upgrade). It was similar in style to Rubino without a phone but with an adequate bathroom. I also made several complaints to different staff about the first night spent in Rubino, requesting compensation but no-one had the decency to get back to me (nor did they even bother to leave a note for the management, they want your money and then couldn't care less how your stay is). I strongly recommend against staying at any Hotel Planet hotel and if you do, make sure they put you in the hotel you book. If we were aware beforehand that this was run by the same people than run Hotel Rubino there is no way we would have stayed here. Termini station area is quite nice though; there is a nearby internet cafe open until midnight, several places to eat and many shops at the station itself (as well as a decent police/security presence).

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: GroundSwell
Reviews.Content: What a dump if you have the opportunity stay at the train station floor do it.The rooms at Blu are terrible.No phone, the beds are like sleeping on the old stone roads in Rome and the pillows are even worse.I was not expecting the Hilton but this was rubbish.The staff or lack there of are cranky and slow.If staying in Hotel Blu you must check in at Hotel Planet on the 5th floor and if you have luggage the elevator is tiny.Hell even a man with a average sized package will have trouble getting in and outta there.GO ELSEWHERE

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Soggiorno Blu
HotelInfo.Address: Via Magenta, 39, 00185 Rome, Italy
